person.persName: Alfred Franklin Gowdy (Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant and state representative)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, merchant and politician. Marion County, Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Gowdy and Nancy Burnet Gowdy. Married to Maria Smith Gowdy in Green County, Kentucky, on May 31, 1842. Father of Alice M. Gowdy. Married to Sarah Lois Hotchkiss Gowdy in Green County, Kentucky, on July 20, 1846. Father of Alfred Benoni Gowdy, David W. Gowdy, John Edwin Gowdy, Emma Jane Gowdy, James T. Gowdy, and George H. Gowdy. Merchant in Taylor County in 1850. Employed J. H. Sanders as a clerk in Taylor County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1850. Special judge of the Circuit Court in Taylor County in 1858. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Taylor County from 1859 to 1861. Merchant in Taylor County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1860. Merchant in partnership with John M. Turner and D.M. Mourning in Turner, Mourning, & Company in Taylor County from 1862 to 1863. Tobacco merchant in partnership with John M. Turner in Taylor County from 1863 to 1864.
